result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Georgia.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with any co-defendants or any victims listed in the criminal complaint. Not to possess or use any checks/checking accounts (only paychecks from his employer made out to him). Not to leave the State of Georgia unless approved by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 138 days were granted. LAST 42 Days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon J Sparks in court with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3  YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS         **transfer allowed to State of Georgia** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Co-Defendant's or any victims listed in criminal complaint
____Not to use or possess any checks/checking account (only paychecks from his employer made out to him)
____Not to leave the State of Georgia unless approved by agent
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  180 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions (credit for 138 days) - last 42 days STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon J Sparks in court, in custody, with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2-8 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Redetzke requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon J. Sparks in court, in custody, with Attorney Kirk Redetzke who appears by telephone.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is called with Case #15CF539, 15CF542, 15CF545 and 15CF546.  All attorneys on all cases are present (Attorney Kirk Redetzke appears by telephone).   Court advises all parties of anticipated timeline for jury trial commencing on Monday, August 10, 2015.  Court orders counsels to submit proposed jury instructions to the court by 8/6/15 status date.  Court orders/requests all counsel to submit their proposed questions to jury panel by 8/6/15, as well as an approximate estimate of time on opening/closing statements.  Court states all exhibits should be marked before jury trial and requests parties to use projector/doc cam to show exhibits during trial.  Court reminds parties to provide street clothes for their clients for trial day (days).
Hearing on July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Jury status hearing on August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon J Sparks in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Due to the Speedy Trial Demand being made, attorney Redetzke to get court date from the clerks office. Attorney Redetzke presents bail motion arguments. State objects to any modification and presents arguments. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.
Arraignment on May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brandon J Sparks in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Abbey Nickolie for Michelle Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Chief James Gage from the Village of Elm Grove was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense moves for dismissal and presents arguments. Court denied. Court finds probable cause that a felony was comitted and binds the defendant over for trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.
